intro: Diodia polymorpha var. lasiodisca, commonly known as the hairy dill or hairy diodia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The species is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
